title: The future of beauty packaging: Three questions for Frédéric Dreux, Unilever - Premium beauty
summary: Unilever is committed to reducing virgin plastic use in its packaging, aiming to halve it by 2030. This commitment involves increasing the use of recycled plastic, exploring alternative materials like paper, aluminum, and glass, and promoting reusable and refillable packaging models.  They are collaborating with the World Economic Forum's Consumers Beyond Waste initiative to standardize definitions, measurements, and reporting for these sustainable packaging approaches.

title: The future of materials - Deloitte
summary: Eastman, a global specialty materials company, is developing innovative chemical recycling technologies to transform plastic waste into valuable materials. They have implemented Carbon Renewal Technology (CRT) and Polyester Renewal Technology (PRT), which convert plastic waste into syngas and recycled polyester, respectively, significantly reducing greenhouse gas emissions compared to traditional methods. This commitment to sustainable innovation aims to reduce waste, conserve resources, and create a circular economy for plastics.
product_or_process: Carbon Renewal Technology (CRT) and Polyester Renewal Technology (PRT)
greenwashing: The article doesn't suggest any deceptive practices related to the environmental benefits of Eastman's chemical recycling technologies, indicating they are not engaging in greenwashing.

title: Pernod Ricard unveils packaging sustainability updates across portfolio - Packaging Europe
summary: Pernod Ricard, a leading spirits company, is implementing various sustainability initiatives to reduce packaging waste and enhance its environmental footprint. These initiatives include removing unnecessary secondary packaging from its products, designing lighter and recyclable bottles, and partnering with eco-conscious organizations. The company aims to make all its packaging recyclable, reusable, compostable, or completely removed by 2025, aligning with its 'Good Times from a Good Place' sustainability roadmap.
